comment.author: 48513457@N00
comment._content: This shot was taken a split second before hilarity ensued.

comment.author: 44979020@N00
comment._content: Well, at least he's going to land on the side with the cushion.

comment.author: 48796744@N00
comment._content: Odd caption. They didn't copy the wrong spelling of athletes as "athlets" as it is written on the original photo (that's the policy in some places), but they did their own spelling version instead, viz, "atheletes". I blame the Greeks. They started it all — phthsis, indeed!

comment.author: 25065232@N00
comment._content: yeah, fix the typo on the photo title.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks!  We'll fix the typo in the source data and reload the description

comment.author: 32981092@N02
comment._content: This picture is actually kind of upsetting. I'm just curious as to why or who would let a group of blind kids try such dangerous gymnastics. It doesn't look like they have any supervision or anyone to spot their landing, yet someone was around to capture it on film. A little dissapointing...

comment.author: 29608875@N00
comment._content: yeah they should be kept in a padded room and constantly reminded that they are different from everyone else and they shouldn't try to do anything but read braille.  dumbass.

comment.author: 32981092@N02
comment._content: I never said they should be locked away and unable to experience life, maybe you shouldn't treat people so poorly and refrain from calling a me a "dumbass"  and notice that I was concerned about the well being of someone about to land flat on their back, blind or not this is a dangerous situation. No need to put immature comments up especially when you don't know what you're talking about.

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: I don't think he is actually about to fall, it seems to me this is more just a position or transition to another pose. You can see he has a firm grip on the pommel.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Disability History, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
